alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:47AM EDT until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County. Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County. Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County. Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ada affecting Kent County. Grand River at Grand Rapids affecting Kent County. Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. Thornapple River Near Caledonia affecting Kent County. Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County. .One to two inches of rain has fallen during the past 36 hours and will take a few days to flow from the tributaries into the river. Generally dry weather is expected during the next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EDT Thursday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 03/05/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
